thread.title: Major candidates for La. governor meet in TV debate Thursday
thread.title_full: Major candidates for La. governor meet in TV debate Thursday - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Major candidates for La. governor meet in TV debate Thursday
text:
By MELINDA DESLATTE
Associated Press BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) - The four major candidates in the Louisiana governor's race are squaring off in their first televised debate together, with attack ads intensifying as the Oct. 24 election nears.
The debate is Thursday night at WDSU-TV in New Orleans.
Though a previous forum aired on television, Republican U.S. Sen. David Vitter didn't participate.
His three chief rivals - Republican Public Service Commissioner Scott Angelle, Republican Lt. Gov. Jay Dardenne and Democratic state Rep. John Bel Edwards - have criticized Vitter as skipping most events where he can't see questions in advance.
Also in the debate are two lesser-known candidates: Democrat Cary Deaton and Jeremy Odom, an independent.
Outside of the New Orleans area, people can watch the 6 p.m. debate on KALB-TV in Alexandria, KAQY-TV in Monroe and KTBS-TV in Shreveport.
